title: 105_hr3117
content: The Civil Rights Commission Act of 1998 extends appropriations and authorizations for the Civil Rights Commission Act of 1983 until 2001. It also amends the staff director section. The Civil Rights Commission Act of 1983 is amended to specify the term of office for the Staff Director as 4 years, with an annual performance review by the Commission. Section 4 of the Civil Rights Commission Act of 1983 is amended to include provisions regarding the Commission being considered an agency for specific purposes under title 5, United States Code. Additionally, a requirement for an independent audit of the Commission's financial statements is established starting from the fiscal year ending September 30, 1998. SEC. 6. TERMS OF MEMBERS amended to 5 years. Applicable to terms starting after enactment. SEC. 7. REPORTS amended to require a report by September 30 each year. SEC. 8. SPECIFIC DIRECTIONS TO THE COMMISSION. The Commission must implement GAO recommendations by June 30, 1998, regarding administrative instructions and regulations. A report on ADA enforcement is due by September 30, 1998. Additionally, a report on religious freedom in public schools must be submitted by the same date. The report on religious freedom in public schools will assess the enforcement of laws to prevent discrimination based on religion and review the activities of federal agencies like the Departments of Justice and Education in protecting religious freedom. It will also describe the rights of students and others under the Federal Equal Access Act. The Commission will submit reports on the crisis of young African-American males and fair employment law enforcement by September 30, 1999. Additionally, they will address regulatory obstacles facing minority entrepreneurs. The Commission will conduct a study on regulatory obstacles facing minority entrepreneurs and report the results by September 30, 1999. SEC. 9. ADVISORY COMMITTEES. Amendment to the Civil Rights Commission Act of 1983 to ensure advisory committees conduct fact-finding activities and provide balanced reports to the Commission.
